attributes.action: proper teacher training, and resources for consistent delivery across Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: Teaching Scottish Gaelic in schools is vital because it preserves a unique part of Scotland’s cultural heritage and identity. It connects young people to their history and traditions while preventing the language from disappearing. By making Gaelic part of every child’s education, we build pride, strengthen Scotland’s cultural diversity, and ensure the language survives for future generations. Without this commitment through education, Gaelic risks being lost forever.
attributes.background: We want the Government to make Gaelic a required subject in all public schools. Every child in Scotland should have the chance to learn the national language. We also ask for proper funding, teacher training, and learning resources to support this.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.  
 
The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:  

https://www.parliament.scot/chamber-and-committees/committees/current-and-previous-committees/session-6-citizen-participation-and-public-petitions-committee
